commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 and cap Sphinx on Python2

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix the requirements job which was broken by
https://review.opendev.org/657890 adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ieabcd4e8c5e5354125a63e89b9b60931c760858a
(cherry picked from commit 011fa22c42506e63229cca7e5fc65f81b6e0aabf)

[{'created': '2019-05-16 12:37:31.000000000', 'message': 'Updated constraints on storage state

Given that the storage state is not based only on the storage state
anymore, the unique constraint on the "identifier" column of the
"cloudkitty_storage_states" table has been dropped. A unique constraint
on the "identifier", "scope_key", "collector" and "fetcher" columns
has been added.

Story: 2005699

commit_message:
Updated constraints on storage state

Given that the storage state is not based only on the storage state
anymore, the unique constraint on the "identifier" column of the
"cloudkitty_storage_states" table has been dropped. A unique constraint
on the "identifier", "scope_key", "collector" and "fetcher" columns
has been added.

Change-Id: Ifbcc47156541cea6f9e1e5cf75923895d3219f6f
Story: 2005699
Task: 31020

subject: Update documentation to get compute node metrics
messages:
[{'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-16 13:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-16 13:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi this is my first patch for ceilometer. I have found that when I specified the compute_monitors parameter in /etc/nova/nova.conf it did not enable the compute node metrics. I had to specify the parameter in /etc/nova/nova-cpu.conf and then it worked as expected.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-05-17 00:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Dantali0n, Thanks for your commit. nova-cpu.conf is a config from devstack, actually install from rpm or deb there are only nova.conf. So I think the documentation is right.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-17 05:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi, Dantali0n, Thanks for your commit. nova-cpu.conf is a config
 > from devstack, actually install from rpm or deb there are only
 > nova.conf. So I think the documentation is right.

Ah okaj, that makes sense we can abandon this then.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-17 14:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We will update Watchers devstack documenation to reflect the necassary.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-16 13:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update documentation to get compute node metrics

The documenation is updated to reflect the correct nova configuration
file when settings compute_monitors.

Change-Id: Ie72790c59490feaf6bc2f18b1334f564e5582ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Update documentation to get compute node metrics

The documenation is updated to reflect the correct nova configuration
file when settings compute_monitors.

Change-Id: Ie72790c59490feaf6bc2f18b1334f564e5582ee3

commit_message:
Exclude broken ironicclient versions 2.5.2 and 2.7.1

A change was merged to these versions that somehow broke Nova accessing
Ironic. While a fix has been posted in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659592/
we should block these releases to unbreak the CI for now.

Change-Id: I0331d061c13f5e2e109443c5210e0924b73ce0be
Story: #2005723
Task: #31055
(cherry picked from commit ba7f936fd797eba30946f3f263e6050181905988)

commit_message:
DNM - Testing Neutron Events

The job's don't seem to use the depends-on ironicclient.
Trying to add ironicclient to required projects.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/637841

commit_message:
Drop private argument for include/import role

Since ansible 2.8 dropped private argument is not supported anymore:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/45038

commit_message:
[tricircle] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Ic9a59b7e09dbedc030ee7312f0a9498412538bcc

commit_message:
[monasca] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I1f39fbe2ea916bef45e5c696727825647015e5c7

commit_message:
Change grpcio version in requirements.txt to >=1.11.0

grpcio version 1.10.0 does not work with eventlet, we require commit
a75712a71f01c06d7e5868a75cb62b26d775e5df

While there, add protobuf explicitely to reqirements.txt. It is no
longer a grpc dependency from version 1.12.0

Change-Id: I356c291a570e2b726746b0670dcd105353c75c0b

commit_message:
WIP - start working on ansible playbooks for LOSF

These playbooks would install LOSF requirements, compile LOSF. It will
also need to add a diskfile_module line to the object-server
configuration and start the index server processes.

Change-Id: Ief585c42c5deaf09283416ee37c74e08c942916d

Pass auth context to the event publishers

Pass the auth context to the event publishers for integration with other OpenStack services.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 12:45:15.000000000', 'message': 'Change the Makefile to work on vagrant swift all in one

With the $PATH properly set (needs $HOME/go/bin, and the path to cmake,
if needed), it works and compiles swift-rpc-losf.
But I removed the build/install distinction which we may want to keep?

Also, -Wl,-rpath does not appear to work yet, it would be nice for the
binary not to require setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH to find leveldb.so
It seems that the "go get levigo.." line compiles it but does not
install the binary, and the "go get" line eventually installs the
binary, but without the proper LDFLAGS. I don't know how to specify them
with the new go module system, I'll try again tomorrow

Change-Id: Ie6e4c6ae82a485a0ca74505b6cc87a39ba0c8603
'}, {'created': '2019-04-11 08:05:40.000000000', 'message': 'Change the Makefile to work on vagrant swift all in one

Change-Id: Ie6e4c6ae82a485a0ca74505b6cc87a39ba0c8603
'}, {'created': '2019-05-02 00:25:36.000000000', 'message': 'Change the Makefile to work on vagrant swift all in one

if needed), it works and compiles swift-rpc-losf.
But I removed the build/install distinction which we may want to keep?

Also, -Wl,-rpath does not appear to work yet, it would be nice for the

It seems that the "go get levigo.." line compiles it but does not

binary, but without the proper LDFLAGS. I don't know how to specify them

Change-Id: Ie6e4c6ae82a485a0ca74505b6cc87a39ba0c8603

commit_message:
Change the Makefile to work on vagrant swift all in one

With the $PATH properly set (needs $HOME/go/bin, and the path to cmake,
if needed), it works and compiles swift-rpc-losf.
But I removed the build/install distinction which we may want to keep?

Also, -Wl,-rpath does not appear to work yet, it would be nice for the
binary not to require setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH to find leveldb.so
It seems that the "go get levigo.." line compiles it but does not
install the binary, and the "go get" line eventually installs the
binary, but without the proper LDFLAGS. I don't know how to specify them
with the new go module system, I'll try again tomorrow

Change-Id: Ie6e4c6ae82a485a0ca74505b6cc87a39ba0c8603

subject: Use statsd v2, set LD_LIBRARY_PATH for index server
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 16:34:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use statsd v2, set LD_LIBRARY_PATH for index server

Change  rpc_test.go to import statsd/v2 rather than statsd.
Set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to /usr/local/lib when starting the index server.

commit_message:
Use statsd v2, set LD_LIBRARY_PATH for index server

Change  rpc_test.go to import statsd/v2 rather than statsd.
Set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to /usr/local/lib when starting the index server.

Change-Id: Iffb565b1b841fddabc01de0fc3861f805e4ce119

commit_message:
Scale Undercloud with a Minion

During the Train PTG, we identified that scaling the heat-engine and
ironic-conductor may be beneficial to improving scale. This spec
proposes to create a new undercloud minion node so that an operator
can provide additional systems for heat and ironic usages.

Change-Id: Ic5a5a785b4102383d7369b3a825fe5d615d381c0
Related-Blueprint: undercloud-minion

commit_message:
Remove use of 'private' for include_role for ansible 2.8

in previous versions was not implemented. This option will
be removed in Ansible v2.8"

[{'created': '2018-07-08 19:28:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add newer docker registry proxy to mirror-info

Docker newer than 17.10 needs a different registry proxy, which we run.
Add an entry to the file to let people set such a thing up. Keep the old
one though, because older dockers need the old proxy cache.

Change-Id: Ibb4bd00784ae7445bd12be1cee36db55afb115d8
'}]
commit_message:
Add newer docker registry proxy to mirror-info

Docker newer than 17.10 needs a different registry proxy, which we run.
Add an entry to the file to let people set such a thing up. Keep the old
one though, because older dockers need the old proxy cache.

Change-Id: Ibb4bd00784ae7445bd12be1cee36db55afb115d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-17 11:55:54.000000000', 'message': 'mysql: enable local PersistentVolume on single pod cluster

There is currently an issue with deploying single pod mysql clusters
in which restarting or killing the pod will result in a crashloopbackoff
due to all the mysql data being lost and the start script thinking that
the cluster was alive before, due to the grastate configmap, and trying to
continue starting the cluster without bootstrapping it.

Due to this, during our gating or testing if the mysql pod is killed or
restarted, we will lose all the data, resulting in a broken environment.

Even if we could fix the script to know that it should bootstrap the cluster
again, our env will be nroken as all the data from the rest of the openstack
services is lost, so we would need to delete every chart and install it again
so the databases are recreated and data populated. This is something that we
cant do during gating as its time consuming and we could end up in a loop never
progressing further.

Instead this patch will deploy a local volume for mysql so the data is kept intact
in case there is a pod restart, so it can recover itself and maintain all the data
we had up to that point.

New values are introduced to control this, mainly a singleClusterVolume key that
containts all needed values for deploying the local volume.

This is only enabled if volume.enabled is set to false, singleClusterVolume.enabled
is true and pod.replicas.server equals 1 as to respect the existing behaviour.

Note that if the pod is rescheduled into another worker then we will hit the
same issue, as the volume is local to the worker, we would get a chrashloopbackoff.

This patch is maily to unblock gating and developers hitting the issue and having
a single pod with no storage enabled is not recommended or supported.

Change-Id: I41db91139faca740860eeaec6f15d57283c1d4dd
Story: 2004702
'}]
commit_message:
mysql: enable local PersistentVolume on single pod cluster

There is currently an issue with deploying single pod mysql clusters
in which restarting or killing the pod will result in a crashloopbackoff
due to all the mysql data being lost and the start script thinking that
the cluster was alive before, due to the grastate configmap, and trying to
continue starting the cluster without bootstrapping it.

Due to this, during our gating or testing if the mysql pod is killed or
restarted, we will lose all the data, resulting in a broken environment.

Even if we could fix the script to know that it should bootstrap the cluster
again, our env will be nroken as all the data from the rest of the openstack
services is lost, so we would need to delete every chart and install it again
so the databases are recreated and data populated. This is something that we
cant do during gating as its time consuming and we could end up in a loop never
progressing further.

Instead this patch will deploy a local volume for mysql so the data is kept intact
in case there is a pod restart, so it can recover itself and maintain all the data
we had up to that point.

New values are introduced to control this, mainly a singleClusterVolume key that
containts all needed values for deploying the local volume.

This is only enabled if volume.enabled is set to false, singleClusterVolume.enabled
is true and pod.replicas.server equals 1 as to respect the existing behaviour.

Note that if the pod is rescheduled into another worker then we will hit the
same issue, as the volume is local to the worker, we would get a chrashloopbackoff.

This patch is maily to unblock gating and developers hitting the issue and having
a single pod with no storage enabled is not recommended or supported.

Change-Id: I41db91139faca740860eeaec6f15d57283c1d4dd
Story: 2004702

(1 comment)

This is really good.

Other than the typo and the zuul failure, one thing you might tweak is the intro. Right now it warns about not being prescriptive, but I think it might be useful to be more explicit that:

* There is a normal way to do service discovery, this is not it.
* What's described here may be useful in some circumstances (for example the examples below).

You sort of do that already,but I think it would be useful to be a bit more clear.

(That said, I think bootstrapping service catalog discovery via DNS is great, let's all do that...)"}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2019-04-09 13:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2019-05-17 07:48:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update Sphinx requirements and actually use Python 3 for docs

This fixes building the guidelines (again) since Sphinx 2.0.0 is not
compatible with Python 2.7, and the way we use basepython in tox.ini
is not correct (resulting in Python 2 being used by default).

Change-Id: Ieeeb319caa6d7a8dad78857c7dce105da33d2dd2
'}]
commit_message:
Update Sphinx requirements and actually use Python 3 for docs

This fixes building the guidelines (again) since Sphinx 2.0.0 is not
compatible with Python 2.7, and the way we use basepython in tox.ini
is not correct (resulting in Python 2 being used by default).

Change-Id: Ieeeb319caa6d7a8dad78857c7dce105da33d2dd2

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start
marking it there as well.

Change-Id: Ieaf9c77d62551352833a644ab22dff261c08bb78

subject: Change package order in alphabetic.
messages:
[{'account_id': 30395, 'date': '2019-05-17 07:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-17 07:07:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30395, 'date': '2019-05-17 07:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30395, 'date': '2019-05-17 10:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Allow cluster delete to detach policies & delete receivers

This patch allows the cluster delete actions to detach policies
and delete receivers for the cluster being deleted. This
simplifies deleting clusters by not having to detach or delete
all dependancies from it beforehand.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/657713/

commit_message:
Update heat-translator-1.3.1 for param values

If user provides parameter file while creating VNF using scaling policy,
earlier it was failing with error 'The Parameter was not provided". This issue
already fixed in heat-translator-1.3.1.
Update lower-constraints.txt and requirements.txt with the same.

Depends-On: I67b9f53ac4cc0e4318fb7d62ac3d389c8cafbab2o
Change-Id: Ie1a6d859f91d8ad2decaaa1606dda1858df782a0
Closes-Bug: #1823860
Closes-Bug: #1799683

Allows the charm to filter out interfaces from data-port
that don't exist on the local host.

commit_message:
Use AuthMethod context

Rather than use hard coded auth methods, use the protocal named passed
over the keystone-fid-service-provider relation.

Also, when using federation do not allow the "external" method as they
are mutually exclusive.

Change-Id: I08f0632630d7f0e8d2d7ddb057e02f9febf9ad6f
Closes-Bug: #1828015
Closes-Bug: #1828018

[{'created': '2019-04-25 14:07:18.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly mock loopingcall in unit tests

We mock sleep(), but it actually uses EventletEvent.wait from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I49340bfedd3e63316a79f166ce0874d5020b862a
'}, {'created': '2019-05-15 10:45:26.000000000', 'message': 'Tests: replace mocking loopingcall with zero interval

We mock sleep(), but LoopingCall, depending on version either uses
a private wrapper around eventlet.Event or one from oslo_utils.
Since mocking them correctly requires mocking private methods, this
change sets the loop interval to zero, bypassing waiting.

This reduces the time required for running disk_partitioner tests
from 20 seconds to less than 1 second.

Change-Id: I49340bfedd3e63316a79f166ce0874d5020b862a
'}]
commit_message:
Tests: replace mocking loopingcall with zero interval

We mock sleep(), but LoopingCall, depending on version either uses
a private wrapper around eventlet.Event or one from oslo_utils.
Since mocking them correctly requires mocking private methods, this
change sets the loop interval to zero, bypassing waiting.

This reduces the time required for running disk_partitioner tests
from 20 seconds to less than 1 second.

Change-Id: I49340bfedd3e63316a79f166ce0874d5020b862a

commit_message:
Add framework for ceilometer-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of ceilometer-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I6e76b74b2f02251ee39025e02de44b13568ebed2
Story: 2003657
Task: 27732

commit_message:
Remove try: ... finally: pass

The handle_errors decorator handles exceptions,
try ... finally ... is redundant

Change-Id: I8142dc10b2e8300aedaa59de77839e1885568cc6

commit_message:
[WIP] Modify managers/pool.py to use Flask Server

This patch migrates managers/pool.py from BaseHTTPServer
to a Flask Server. Since the current version of the management
tool is destinated to devstack deployment, not to production.
Moreover, new functionalities are being added to the manager, such as:
list ports and scale pool.

This newer version of the Pool Manager will also be used by kubectl plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1754737
Change-Id: Icaa8ce03d5670296fa420db514abc96a6927b427

commit_message:
Fix typo in zuul tenant config

We are loading a project that doesn't exist. A follow up to this should
be to compare projects.yaml and our tenant config to make sure the repo
exists.

Change-Id: I810fdf67b0a9530b5515b26b4b0e25710b2a0ba5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 04:28:03.000000000', 'message': "Use endpoint_override in version negotiation

Change [1] introduced the usage of endpoint_filter when deciding which
endpoint to use during version negotiation. This requires properly
setting interface/region/service_type in order to properly pick the
endpoint. But, sometimes (for example in Kolla-ansible), the endpoint
url is explicitly defined. In the event of the endpoint being explicitly
defined, it should take priority here.

It should be noted that even though SessionClient extends from
keystoneauth1's adapter.LegacyJsonAdapter, the `request` function within
_make_simple_request is being called on the nested Session object, not
the Adapter itself. If it was called on the Adapter this problem
wouldn't exist, as the `endpoint_override` (or `endpoint`) kwarg passed
in to the constructor of the SessionClient would already take
precedence.

Additionally: Adds a release note to the older branch as this is a
fix that needs to be released and is worthy of change visibility
in release notes.

[1]: I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce

Change-Id: I69dc2c88648ba1d09a9ad3ab3435662e8d1ea6ff
Related-Bug: #1818295
(cherry picked from commit 8071d5de57c728ce09d25d04c8c9fe48cd7db42e)
(cherry picked from commit b40630f3b3e747ae4a26d31e8e292554b99713f2)
"}]
commit_message:
Use endpoint_override in version negotiation

Change [1] introduced the usage of endpoint_filter when deciding which
endpoint to use during version negotiation. This requires properly
setting interface/region/service_type in order to properly pick the
endpoint. But, sometimes (for example in Kolla-ansible), the endpoint
url is explicitly defined. In the event of the endpoint being explicitly
defined, it should take priority here.

It should be noted that even though SessionClient extends from
keystoneauth1's adapter.LegacyJsonAdapter, the `request` function within
_make_simple_request is being called on the nested Session object, not
the Adapter itself. If it was called on the Adapter this problem
wouldn't exist, as the `endpoint_override` (or `endpoint`) kwarg passed
in to the constructor of the SessionClient would already take
precedence.

Additionally: Adds a release note to the older branch as this is a
fix that needs to be released and is worthy of change visibility
in release notes.

[1]: I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce

Change-Id: I69dc2c88648ba1d09a9ad3ab3435662e8d1ea6ff
Related-Bug: #1818295
(cherry picked from commit 8071d5de57c728ce09d25d04c8c9fe48cd7db42e)
(cherry picked from commit b40630f3b3e747ae4a26d31e8e292554b99713f2)

commit_message:
Add framework for ceilometer-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of ceilometer-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I6e76b74b2f02251ee39025e02de44b13568ebed2
Story: 2003657
Task: 27732

Add libpq-dev to bindeps.txt and install doc

Because it is needed to install psycopg 2.8.2 on ubuntu. Resolves
dependency install failure on unit tests on ubuntu nodes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-16 19:27:32.000000000', 'message': 'Stable branch combination fix

We have two dueling problems in the stable branches that have to be
fixed at the same time:

* bandit 1.6.0
* sphinx 2.0

This is a squash of the two cherry-picks from master:

----------
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6385d64237c9973dd4c7dd53efb6664ea2c719da)

----------

Update sphinx requirement.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, start cappingit there as well.

(cherry picked from commit f1791179768115b6d074f70f9a8695f9c1e0b9f5)

Change-Id: I0076645d9e1a2429efce39f51ceea679fa6c13cb
'}]
commit_message:
Stable branch combination fix

We have two dueling problems in the stable branches that have to be
fixed at the same time:

* bandit 1.6.0
* sphinx 2.0

This is a squash of the two cherry-picks from master:

----------
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6385d64237c9973dd4c7dd53efb6664ea2c719da)

----------

Update sphinx requirement.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, start cappingit there as well.

(cherry picked from commit f1791179768115b6d074f70f9a8695f9c1e0b9f5)

Change-Id: I0076645d9e1a2429efce39f51ceea679fa6c13cb

commit_message:
Check LCStatus instead of MessageID to determine if an iDRAC is ready

We are currently checking the MessageID to determine if an iDRAC
is ready. This patch is to check the value of LCStatus instead of
MessageID. If the value of LCStatus is "0", then the iDRAC is
considered ready.

Change-Id: I3426c226c4bb3cdcc95b98e9b203f100bb6777d5

commit_message:
Add relnote on cinderclient minver bump to 4.0.1

A fix for bug 1824017 bumped the minimum version requirement of
python-cinderclient to 4.0.0. The fix was backported to stable/stein,
so the minimum version bump should be covered by a release note.

python-cinderclient requirement is bumped to >=4.0.1
as 4.0.0 is blocked by global-requirements.txt [1].

It was suggested by the release team in the review of
horizon stein update release [2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/commit/1baf07a77333fc57d9d4a669d0265b0e687fd031/global-requirements.txt#L256
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655447/

Change-Id: I2b43e159da7e58980b2810a104ae2418f237d1c7
Related-Bug: #1824017

commit_message:
Pin stable/queens to xenial nodeset

Bionic instances do not have nodejs 4. This patch pins stable/queens
to ubuntu-xenial nodes.

To resolve the following error:
apt.cache.FetchFailedException: W:The repository
'https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x bionic Release'
does not have a Release file.

Change-Id: I8cd1b22b636098bf26c880adce0ffb34f4ef79ae
(cherry picked from commit 353cc57d9be3f4aac6bc2adde70831f76da459f9)

commit_message:
Add the missing protocol for listener

According to the octavia api:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#listeners,
there miss the 'HTTPS' protocol.

Change-Id: I1d4857876a151148348ac79d554db2c4c6616559
(cherry picked from commit 25a8013853df844b2b2a2e631c582b854aa46ce7)

commit_message:
Pin stable/rocky to xenial nodeset

Bionic instances do not have nodejs 4. This patch pins stable/rocky
to ubuntu-xenial nodes.

To resolve the following error:
apt.cache.FetchFailedException: W:The repository
'https://deb.nodesource.com/node_4.x bionic Release'
does not have a Release file.

Change-Id: I8cd1b22b636098bf26c880adce0ffb34f4ef79ae
(cherry picked from commit 353cc57d9be3f4aac6bc2adde70831f76da459f9)

subject: multithread publishing
messages:
[{'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 18:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:31:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

i don't like special cases so i +2

but i don't understand that code so feel free to wait for sileht :)"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 22:29:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

... ideally we wouldn't need this, but it seems like gnocchi publishing takes a few seconds if it needs to create a new resource (not sure why)

but more importantly, i have no idea why the threads sit idle. it really does seem like it'll just randomly hang for a bit even though there's stuff in executor queue. after first i thought it was because it's busy acknowledging previous messages but sometimes it doesn't hang even after processing a 'big' batch of messages."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-27 23:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

ok, yeah, it's sitting idle because acknowledging takes forever. see:
http://logs.openstack.org/09/520109/22/check/oslo.messaging-telemetry-dsvm-integration-rabbit/4d0cd5b/logs/screen-ceilometer-anotification.txt.gz

searching on "1c152eebf46443dbb75a34e6cb08ad69", i have 4 logs:

- "WHHHHHHAT" (2017-11-27 23:23:19.309) - captures when batch is first fetched and queued.
- "OKKKKKKK" (2017-11-27 23:23:19.320) - captures when batch is picked up and dispatched for processing
- "DOOOOOOOONNNNNEE" (2017-11-27 23:23:20.889) - captures when batch is finished processing by all endpoints
- "FIIIIIIIIIINALLY" (2017-11-27 23:23:30.296) - captures when all the messages are acknowledged. so it takes 10s for it to ack all the messages

multi-threading can resolve this (i believe). but ideally we can ack faster. we can pass multiple=True[1] in kombu to acknowledge all messages up to current message but i don't believe this works for multiple threads.

[1] https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/blob/03fb08379dd8aad9dccae157efcb484be4650b73/amqp/channel.py#L1345'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2017-11-28 02:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:21:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Mehdi seems to have fix'd oslo.messaging issue so in theory, this isn't really needed... but everything i have in commit message still holds true so i'm not sure if we want to merge or not."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:49:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I'd still be in favor of it since it's a less of a use case, but i'm not competent enough to have a strong opinion"}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2019-05-17 03:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer zhaolihui with the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by zhaolihui <zhaolh@awcloud.com>
'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 18:31:03.000000000', 'message': "multithread publishing

gnocchi publisher is slower than previous workflow which dumped to
queue for collector. there is a very good chance one thread per worker
(where each worker handles many queues) cannot handle processing
requirements.

we use to set publisher to 1 thread to preserve ordering but in
reality, this only addressed a scenario where something
catastrophic happened and resulted in a backlog in interim pipeine
queues. in this scenario, one thread allows us to process
queue items one by one so that there is no racing and transforms
are handled (as well as possible). in reality, i don't believe it
will ever recover because items will be added faster than it's
processed by a single thread.

this change will improve performance but it will sacrifice any
chance of a graceful recovery if interim queues get backed up.

Change-Id: Ic9a495b2cad98363fa9161b036387b13a91e5dff
"}, {'created': '2017-11-27 19:29:38.000000000', 'message': "multithread publishing

Change-Id: Ic9a495b2cad98363fa9161b036387b13a91e5dff

commit_message:
multithread publishing

gnocchi publisher is slower than previous workflow which dumped to
queue for collector. there is a very good chance one thread per worker
(where each worker handles many queues) cannot handle processing
requirements.

we use to set publisher to 1 thread to preserve ordering but in
reality, this only addressed a scenario where something
catastrophic happened and resulted in a backlog in interim pipeine
queues. in this scenario, one thread allows us to process
queue items one by one so that there is no racing and transforms
are handled (as well as possible). in reality, i don't believe it
will ever recover because items will be added faster than it's
processed by a single thread.

this change will improve performance but it will sacrifice any
chance of a graceful recovery if interim queues get backed up.

Change-Id: Ic9a495b2cad98363fa9161b036387b13a91e5dff

commit_message:
update sphinx requirement

syncs sphinx dependency with global requirements.
It caps python 2 since sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ia4ad99c8201f48292c35e7b50604d1d87c467eb3
(cherry picked from commit c3a23500cebb0f6bf6650334767d8e245ed83640)

commit_message:
Change to use non-deprecated security group rule syntax

--src-ip and --src-group were deprecated in 2016, change
to use --remote-ip and --remote-group, respectively.
Related to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659400/

Change-Id: Ie609380b130410e3548eeacffd72871c6b5722ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 21:04:15.000000000', 'message': "Stop logging traceback when skipping quiesce

During snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we attempt to quiesce the
instance before doing the snapshot. If quiesce is not supported or the
qemu guest agent is not enabled, we will skip the quiesce and move on
to the snapshot.

Because quiesce is a call to nova-compute over RPC, when the libvirt
driver raises QemuGuestAgentNotEnabled, oslo.messaging will append the
full traceback to the exception message [1] for the remote caller. So,
a LOG.info(..., exp) log of the exception object will result in a log
of the full traceback. Logging of the full traceback causes confusion
for those debugging CI failures.

We would rather not log the full traceback in this case where we are
catching the exception and emitting an INFO message, so we should use
exp.format_message() instead of oslo.messaging's __str__ override.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/40c25c2/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L212

Related-Bug: #1824315

Change-Id: Ibfedcb8814437c53081f5a2993ab84b25d73e557
"}, {'created': '2019-05-15 21:50:16.000000000', 'message': "Stop logging traceback when skipping quiesce

During snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we attempt to quiesce the
instance before doing the snapshot. If quiesce is not supported or the
qemu guest agent is not enabled, we will skip the quiesce and move on
to the snapshot.

Because quiesce is a call to nova-compute over RPC, when the libvirt
driver raises QemuGuestAgentNotEnabled, oslo.messaging will append the
full traceback to the exception message [1] for the remote caller. So,
a LOG.info(..., exp) log of the exception object will result in a log
of the full traceback. Logging of the full traceback causes confusion
for those debugging CI failures.

We would rather not log the full traceback in this case where we are
catching the exception and emitting an INFO message, so we should use
exp.format_message() instead of oslo.messaging's __str__ override. In
the case of NotImplementedError, the best we can do is truncate the
message from the __str__ method override.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/40c25c2/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L212

Related-Bug: #1824315

Change-Id: Ibfedcb8814437c53081f5a2993ab84b25d73e557

commit_message:
Stop logging traceback when skipping quiesce

During snapshot of a volume-backed instance, we attempt to quiesce the
instance before doing the snapshot. If quiesce is not supported or the
qemu guest agent is not enabled, we will skip the quiesce and move on
to the snapshot.

Because quiesce is a call to nova-compute over RPC, when the libvirt
driver raises QemuGuestAgentNotEnabled, oslo.messaging will append the
full traceback to the exception message [1] for the remote caller. So,
a LOG.info(..., exp) log of the exception object will result in a log
of the full traceback. Logging of the full traceback causes confusion
for those debugging CI failures.

We would rather not log the full traceback in this case where we are
catching the exception and emitting an INFO message, so we should use
exp.format_message() instead of oslo.messaging's __str__ override.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/40c25c2/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L212

Related-Bug: #1824315

Change-Id: Ibfedcb8814437c53081f5a2993ab84b25d73e557

commit_message:
Set Content-Type with s3api metadata updates.

S3 supports two metadata operations on object copy: COPY and REPLACE.
When using REPLACE, the Content-Type should be set to the one supplied
by the caller. When using COPY, the existing object's Content-Type value
is used.

Change-Id: Ic7c6278dedef308c9219eb45751abfa5655f144f
Closes-Bug: #1828907

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils import from oslo_serialization

1. oslo project provide jsonutils, and barbican use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json moudule to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.
2. update the primary jsonutils to use alias json

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/barbican/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I9c7bdc4d9fdb55f07f716b2ed5204439fceceb5d

looks barbican had worked this issue and fixed it.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-26 00:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-26 00:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-26 00:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

sure the exception was not due to secrets.status'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-26 09:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

In general, barbican does not raise the exception while getting secrets and the secrets can not be got too.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-26 09:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-27 02:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-27 04:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

strange, looks like secrets.status could raise an exception.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-04-27 06:10:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I have an explanation. Maybe for reducing calls to API side or for other reasons, barbicanclient doesn't do real calls to API until we make anything real.

barbicanclient.secrets.get returns just an instance of class Secrets without making a call to API [1] and only by accessing any property of that instance, barbicanclient will make a real call to API [2]. That is why cleanup became working after you added some debug messages.

I guess we need to fix it at our service class[3] by accessing any of lazy properties and reuse service class here. This will make 'barbican.get_secret' atomic action more accurate. 

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/python-barbicanclient/blob/master/barbicanclient/v1/secrets.py#L445
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/python-barbicanclient/blob/master/barbicanclient/v1/secrets.py#L412-L415
[3] - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/services/key_manager/barbican.py#L56"}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-04-28 02:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-05-05 09:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2019-05-06 00:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-05-16 23:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-05-16 23:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-05-17 01:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix LP #1819284 and barbican.get_secret of barbican service

Because secret class is lazy in barbican client, secret would
really access the api to get secret properties while calling
some property.

Closes-bug: #1819284

Change-Id: I0e37ccbb0bc74621f9dd47adbff98d64f2f79653

[{'created': '2019-05-16 15:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Do not try to use /v1/v1 when endpoint_override is used

In one of the places where endpoint_override is used we did not strip
the /v1 suffix, resulting in doube /v1/v1 sometimes.

This patch also corrects the way we strip this suffix (str.rstrip accepts
a set of symbols, not a substring; use regex instead).

It remains unclear why the breakage passed the gate initially. I assume
it was not on the active code path until some Nova change.

Story: #2005723
Task: #31051
Change-Id: I3b25f4fb170aa93159ffa8074dc74fa6f50671b7
'}]
commit_message:
Do not try to use /v1/v1 when endpoint_override is used

In one of the places where endpoint_override is used we did not strip
the /v1 suffix, resulting in doube /v1/v1 sometimes.

This patch also corrects the way we strip this suffix (str.rstrip accepts
a set of symbols, not a substring; use regex instead).

It remains unclear why the breakage passed the gate initially. I assume
it was not on the active code path until some Nova change.

Story: #2005723
Task: #31051
Change-Id: I3b25f4fb170aa93159ffa8074dc74fa6f50671b7

commit_message:
Account resource requests of init containers

In before, we calculate the CPU/RAM of a capsule by summing
up the CPU/RAM of all its containers. This will over-calculate
the resource requirement of the capsule since init containers
won't run together with regular containers at any point in time.

This commit fixes this issue. The effective CPU/RAM of capsule
should be the maximum of:
* The largest CPU/RAM of init containers
* the sum of all regular containers

Change-Id: Ia3d4dec13d8cb8d32d2c0ae1ec714f00bcb9bc0a

commit_message:
Don't limit cpu/memory on capsule container

The capsule container (i.e. kubernetes/pause) is just a placeholder
for the namespaces. We don't need to set the cpu/mem limit of this
container because the limit will be set on "real" containers inside
the capsule.

Change-Id: I6baa5e0137dc339183d9c0963421a0d2b097857f

commit_message:
Allow overcommit of cpu resource in docker

Use soft limit (the cpu share option) instead of hard limit (the
cpu quota option) for CPU. This allows a container to use more
CPU than its limits when the system is not full.

Change-Id: I0fd83c684ffd2e7a7a5ac66017e2adda3c3ed113

commit_message:
Add ability to specify multiple search domains

Especially when deploying in an environment where we are deploying
into a subdomain, we need the ability to specify multiple search
domains to be added to /etc/resolv.conf.

Related-Bug: #1828854
Change-Id: I45231fc53c24e1aad3f4a0026696954096430586
(cherry picked from commit 98e561a4d28f0e662abe0f32e27284bd8a5b3276)

`sudo` command not allowed issue [1] due to a typo in the file name.

This patch fixes the name of the temporary files containing potential
ansible variables.

[1] mistral : command not allowed ; TTY=unknown ; PWD=/ ; USER=root
 ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/chown -h validations: /tmp/validation_inputs_PoJRZa

Change-Id: I6699bbbab5cb15a8fd200c144a3d575e9f29ca37
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f3a93bffb85e8732fdd81df32b92486cf357cdfa)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validations_inputs temporary file name

All the validations were failing when running through Mistral with a
`sudo` command not allowed issue [1] due to a typo in the file name.

This patch fixes the name of the temporary files containing potential
ansible variables.

[1] mistral : command not allowed ; TTY=unknown ; PWD=/ ; USER=root
 ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/chown -h validations: /tmp/validation_inputs_PoJRZa

Change-Id: I6699bbbab5cb15a8fd200c144a3d575e9f29ca37
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f3a93bffb85e8732fdd81df32b92486cf357cdfa)

commit_message:
Fix --install-deps bindep for quickstart.sh

bindep is not being called on --install-deps argument.
Now it downloads bindep.txt and calls bindep install.

Change-Id: Id8bd74dd5e55db8a9c0bfff4f713506e9e646dd6
Fixes-Bug: #1828509

commit_message:
workflows/scale: re-use the deployment workbook to run Ansible

To avoid tasks duplications in the tripleo-common workbooks, let's
re-use the deployment workbook with the right parameters so we can avoid
all the config-download tasks.

This patch will reuse tripleo.deployment.v1.config_download_deploy with
the right parameters for a scale-down.

Depends-On: Ibc980e9162bf109de7e7ef338c9bd602174c8448
Change-Id: Ie8e15589197e9725a1cae2d29137f05fefa427c1

commit_message:
Remove duplications of tasks in scale workbook

Since we refactored the deployment workbook, we can easily re-use the
tasks from it in the scale workbook.

A patch in tripleoclient will change the way we call workbooks to re-use
what was done in deployment workbook instead of scale.

Needed-By: Ie8e15589197e9725a1cae2d29137f05fefa427c1
Change-Id: Ibc980e9162bf109de7e7ef338c9bd602174c8448

commit_message:
workbooks/deployment: add support to choose playbook name

In run_ansible task, adding support to change the playbook name, with
the default set to deploy_steps_playbook.yaml for backward
compatibility.
It will allow the tasks to be re-used by another workflow, like scale.

Change-Id: I8adeffb03836de3f1ace7d4311dbff353c10ea14

commit_message:
Add optional property user_password to user context

Add optional property user_password for specifying custom
user password, which could escape of an issue, when
password_regexp requirements defined in keystone config, but
uuid4 generated password is invalid for these requirements.

Change-Id: Ib23262e6b571754b6b59a9e2b1155e9ac51a2090

commit_message:
build containers: multiple platfrom support

- rearrange container build job and parenting so we can fit different
parameters for different distribution
- Explicitly upgrade python decorator module for platform that already
have it installed (pip ansible module doesnt' update)
- Parametrize some hard coded values
- ansible_distribution for kolla base does not work with all
distribution

Task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/994
Change-Id: I4c6c6effc9572b07c341d0cfaf452845835aeaeb

commit_message:
Stable branch combination fix

We have two dueling problems in the stable branches that have to be
fixed at the same time:

* bandit 1.6.0
* sphinx 2.0

This is a squash of the two cherry-picks from master:

----------
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6385d64237c9973dd4c7dd53efb6664ea2c719da)

----------

Update sphinx requirement.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, start cappingit there as well.

(cherry picked from commit f1791179768115b6d074f70f9a8695f9c1e0b9f5)

Change-Id: I0076645d9e1a2429efce39f51ceea679fa6c13cb

commit_message:
Validate output of list_logical_volumes

The charm was checking for the zeroth value of the return value of
list_logical_volumes. However, if no logical volumes are found it
returns an empty list.

This change validates that the list has an entry.

Depends-On: I75a6b1dda15dd7c2cece8cfe97b28317b3d5162b
Change-Id: I2d371dae94dca328cf4782a79e85c1c6fd77f547
Closes-Bug: #1819382

commit_message:
Stable branch combination fix

We have two dueling problems in the stable branches that have to be
fixed at the same time:

* bandit 1.6.0
* sphinx 2.0

This is a squash of the two cherry-picks from master:

----------
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6385d64237c9973dd4c7dd53efb6664ea2c719da)

----------

Update sphinx requirement.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, start cappingit there as well.

(cherry picked from commit f1791179768115b6d074f70f9a8695f9c1e0b9f5)

Change-Id: I0076645d9e1a2429efce39f51ceea679fa6c13cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-04 17:34:12.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Refactor random naming"

This reverts commit e3e7b2722e6b78216373f392af5bfeba1e2da5ec.

After that change, if the test creates a volume type with a given name, it's not unique and therefore can hit a 409 conflict trying to create a volume type with a name that already exists, which can happen when running scenario tests concurrently since several encrypted volume tests use the same volume type name "luks".

See Iecf62d411d2da17c4c983915018e3ed9180ecd11 for an
alternative but this is easier. It's not entirely clear
why the original change was made anyway - why do we care
if the tests create long names? They weren't unnecessary
because they were random to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: I9f5a967514f3c79f861d286f65402e9ec2832cc4
Closes-Bug: #1826953
'}, {'created': '2019-05-04 17:34:45.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Refactor random naming"

commit_message:
Revert "Refactor random naming"

This reverts commit e3e7b2722e6b78216373f392af5bfeba1e2da5ec.

After that change, if the test creates a volume type with a
given name, it's not unique and therefore can hit a 409 conflict
trying to create a volume type with a name that already exists,
which can happen when running scenario tests concurrently since
several encrypted volume tests use the same volume type name "luks".

See Iecf62d411d2da17c4c983915018e3ed9180ecd11 for an
alternative but this is easier. It's not entirely clear
why the original change was made anyway - why do we care
if the tests create long names? They weren't unnecessary
because they were random to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: I9f5a967514f3c79f861d286f65402e9ec2832cc4
Closes-Bug: #1826953

commit_message:
Test macvtap port with resource request

This patch adds a functional test to see that ports with vnic_type
macvtap and with bandwidth resource request are supported.

Change-Id: I3297adbbf36e537a548b5b46f7f4e27eb103f0f8
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

[{'created': '2019-04-16 06:01:53.000000000', 'message': "[Puppet OpenStack] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I7efab90fc9ebb7e4bc3f0e59f07c51a972414062

commit_message:
Add Patrole gate job for stable/stein

Now we have stable/stein branch ready for devstack
and so does for all service projects.

This commit adds the Project testing for stable/stein
by adding new jobs running on stable/stein version of
openstack.
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647867/

Change-Id: I180d1133b4b77ee7aeff596899f9d7ad9b6d14fe

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and
dropping unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train
will ensure that all projects that support Python3 will be tested
against the agreed runtime versions, and make it easier to update them
in future.

Specifically this patch:
- Uses the openstack-python3-train-jobs zuul template rather than
templates for python 36/37.
- Adds Python 3.7 to the setup.cfg classifier.
- Adds py37 to the envlist of tox.ini.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I92e07412e06d5e0bcd4a3ef63643d140243f8205
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

commit_message:
DNM: Revert "Use external placement in functional tests"

This reverts commit 787bb336065155d3923af0d2bfd397ebe857618e.

I'm doing this because we're putting a fix into nova stein placement [1] but that's actually testing against extracted placement because of the change being reverted here.

So I'm going to revert this change, then rebase [1] on top of it and make sure it still passes, then unwind same and abandon this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659206/

Change-Id: Id4cf658645f375b449c6df636c632ed14237b54e

It works for me locally as well if I change the tox.ini to point to the placement version that is also pointed by the commit message's Depends-On line:

@@ -81,7 +81,7 @@ setenv = {[testenv]setenv}
 # Only allow external placement in functional tests.
 deps =
   -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt
-  openstack-placement
+  git+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/placement@refs/changes/35/617935/6#egg=placement
 commands =
   {[testenv]commands}
 # NOTE(cdent): The group_regex describes how stestr will group tests into the


I have one request inline, hence the -1.

Cheers,

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 13:08:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code.

'openstack-placement' is added to test-requirements.txt and
the concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that that
requirement will be satisfied by the master of openstack/placement.
To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in .zuul.yaml
are updated to require openstack/placement.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/617935
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 13:19:50.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code.

'openstack-placement' is added to test-requirements.txt and
the concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that that
requirement will be satisfied by the master of openstack/placement.
To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in .zuul.yaml
are updated to require openstack/placement.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/617935
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 13:42:59.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code is not (yet).

'openstack-placement' is added to test-requirements.txt and
the concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that that
requirement will be satisfied by the master of openstack/placement.
To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in .zuul.yaml
are updated to require openstack/placement.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/617935
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 14:18:42.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code is not (yet).

'openstack-placement' is added to test-requirements.txt and
the concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that that
requirement will be satisfied by the master of openstack/placement.
To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in .zuul.yaml
are updated to require openstack/placement.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/617935
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 17:35:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

'openstack-placement' is added to test-requirements.txt and
the concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that that
requirement will be satisfied by the master of openstack/placement.
To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.

Depends-On: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
"}, {'created': '2018-11-15 10:20:24.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

Master of openstack/placement is required by the functional
tests. It is not added to test-requirements as we do not want
unit tests to depend on placement in any way.

The concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that the
placement requirement will be satisfied correctly if there is a
depends-on. To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement.

Similarly, a test of the comparison function for the api samples tests
is moved into functional, because it depends on placement functionality.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.
This includes changes to automate management of the database.

Depends-On: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

'}, {'created': '2018-11-15 11:22:08.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

openstack-placement is required by the functional tests. It is not
added to test-requirements as we do not want unit tests to depend
on placement in any way.

The concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that the
placement requirement will be satisfied correctly if there is a
depends-on. To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement. This requires adjusting some
test files to use absolute import.

Similarly, a test of the comparison function for the api samples tests
is moved into functional, because it depends on placement functionality.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.
This includes changes to automate management of the database.

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-11-15 13:09:08.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use a placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

openstack-placement is required by the functional tests. It is not
added to test-requirements as we do not want unit tests to depend
on placement in any way.

The concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that the
placement requirement will be satisfied correctly if there is a
depends-on. To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement. This requires adjusting some
test files to use absolute import.

Similarly, a test of the comparison function for the api samples tests
is moved into functional, because it depends on placement functionality.

TestUpgradeCheckResourceProviders in unit.cmd.test_status is removed.
It relies on direct access to a placement database, not the API.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.
This includes changes to automate management of the database.

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: I7d4099c1da425bb4ea115ac51c82f5748203f2d3
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

use placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

openstack-placement is required by the functional tests. It is not
added to test-requirements as we do not want unit tests to depend
on placement in any way, and we enforce this by not having placement
in the test env.

The concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that the
placement requirement will be satisfied correctly if there is a
depends-on. To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement. This requires adjusting some
test files to use absolute import.

Similarly, a test of the comparison function for the api samples tests
is moved into functional, because it depends on placement functionality,

TestUpgradeCheckResourceProviders in unit.cmd.test_status is removed.
It relies on direct access to a placement database, not the API.

The depends on points to a change in openstack/placement which
makes the placement database fixture easier to use externally.
This includes changes to automate management of the database.

Depends-On: Icd629d7cd6d68ca08f9f3b4f0465c3d9a1efeb22
Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

commit_message:
Use external placement in functional tests

Adjust the fixtures used by the functional tests so they
use placement database and web fixtures defined by placement
code. To avoid making redundant changes, the solely placement-
related unit and functional tests are removed, but the placement
code itself is not (yet).

openstack-placement is required by the functional tests. It is not
added to test-requirements as we do not want unit tests to depend
on placement in any way, and we enforce this by not having placement
in the test env.

The concept of tox-siblings is used to ensure that the
placement requirement will be satisfied correctly if there is a
depends-on. To make this happen, the functional jobs defined in
.zuul.yaml are updated to require openstack/placement.

tox.ini has to be updated to use a envdir that is the same
name as job. Otherwise the tox siblings role in ansible cannot work.

The handling of the placement fixtures is moved out of nova/test.py
into the functional tests that actually use it because we do not
want unit tests (which get the base test class out of test.py) to
have anything to do with placement. This requires adjusting some
test files to use absolute import.

Similarly, a test of the comparison function for the api samples tests
is moved into functional, because it depends on placement functionality,

TestUpgradeCheckResourceProviders in unit.cmd.test_status is moved into
a new test file: nova/tests/functional/test_nova_status.py. This is done
because it requires the PlacementFixture, which is only available to
functional tests. A MonkeyPatch is required in the test to make sure that
the right context managers are used at the right time in the command
itself (otherwise some tables do no exist). In the test itself, to avoid
speaking directly to the placement database, which would require
manipulating the RequestContext objects, resource providers are now
created over the API.

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Change-Id: Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

commit_message:
Add nosec in get_free_segmentation_id function

pep8 job fails due to bandit check with an error:
    [B311:blacklist] Standard pseudo-random generators are not suitable 
    for security/cryptographic purposes.

But using the standard random function in the get_free_segmentation_id 
function is suitable, so adding #nosec comment should unbblock the gate.

Change-Id: Iad8e376c503a32300b3e0b504f47a0c81e53a7a8

(1 comment)

I really want this series to land, but don't want to lose my +2 ability by fixing up the things that are bugging me. So I started a followup patch instead [1].

In it, I am not doing the things to "reduce the diff" because they don't make sense in the context of a fresh patch.

As for the unused mock args, rather than removing them with new=mock.Mock(), I'm adding assertions like a good boy.

Once I've subsumed a given patch's updates that way, I'll be happy to approve said patch. In this case, the exercise so far has uncovered a real bug (see inline). I'm not done going through this patch yet, so feel free to wait to fix.

Meanwhile, if you update/rebase this series, please carry [1] along. (You should also feel free to take over that effort and/or squash it into the main series if you like.)

Thanks!

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649471/'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2019-04-04 08:46:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Remove fake_libvirt_utils from connection tests.

The fake implementation of libvirt.utils is confusing to debug
when things go wrong, direct mocks are clearer and keep everything
in one place.

Change-Id: Ief2c959d7c339e11b19e521de6e7d1be2f8722f8

[{'created': '2019-05-14 21:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Blacklist bandit 1.6.0"

This reverts commit ebac8330d8ac81c491a1cb0e16eb23b93d7932ee.

Using the glob that I had not yet had enough coffee to do correctly is a
better solution, and allows us to fix new failures in 1.6.0 which would
break us again when 1.6.1 was released.

Change-Id: Ica473ba71b224cdc0acf815f82d534b6c70a7f54
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Blacklist bandit 1.6.0"

This reverts commit ebac8330d8ac81c491a1cb0e16eb23b93d7932ee.

Using the glob that I had not yet had enough coffee to do correctly is a
better solution, and allows us to fix new failures in 1.6.0 which would
break us again when 1.6.1 was released.

Change-Id: Ica473ba71b224cdc0acf815f82d534b6c70a7f54

commit_message:
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: I110829ef960e3ee146f47871ef076491244bf4fa
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6385d64237c9973dd4c7dd53efb6664ea2c719da)

commit_message:
Update sphinx requirement.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, start cappingit there as well.

Change-Id: I8a7d227b2f925066fc8213aa62b5756927ee263b

commit_message:
Update DragonFlow tests to run with Python 3

As Python 2.7 will soon reach the end of life, we should switch to
Python 3.
This updates the tests to run with that version.

Change-Id: I1014769881786c62d9d6aabf21ca7858a6deb882

commit_message:
Fix various issues

1. Specify Sphinx version while using Python2.7
2. Fix mock verification in test_check_health_with_api_info
3. Move rally-verify job under python3 env
4. Switch tempest verifier default source to opendev.org

Change-Id: I8f92ef87722d057514d0906d068ddaadd88c8758

commit_message:
Remove airship-tempest-plugin from blacklist

This commit removes airship-tempest-plugin entry from the BLACKLIST
since the patch was already merged. And airship/tempest-plugin has a
gate job to verify it, too. There is no reason to store it in the
BLACKLIST anymore.

And this commit also make plugin-sanity-check's basepython python3
because we should use it as a default.

Change-Id: I9c50d327df65fecf8510f6f54f06e9f42da9bea0

commit_message:
Make dns_servers option deprecated

CONF.network.dns_servers is not used anywhere, so this is to deprecate it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:31:52.000000000', 'message': 'mini-mirror: Ignore source config for publishing

Currently, mini-mirror honors per-source configuration files for the
creation of mirrors and publishing; however, some options exposed by
Aptly have a different impact depending on the operation. This commit
removes the per-source configuration file option from the publishing
process and defaults to the aptly config file supplied for all sources
in order to circumvent this issue.

Change-Id: I87659725918e776482aabccb97195216047f4c77

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Ignore src config for publishing

Currently, mini-mirror honors per-source configuration files for the
creation of mirrors and publishing; however, some options exposed by
Aptly have a different impact depending on the operation. This commit
removes the per-source configuration file option from the publishing
process and defaults to the aptly config file supplied for all sources
in order to circumvent this issue.

Change-Id: I87659725918e776482aabccb97195216047f4c77

[{'created': '2019-04-16 05:55:47.000000000', 'message': "[monasca] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

commit_message:
[monasca] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each
deliverables.

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if
there are no code changes sine the previous release, sadly
that's non-trivial to detect en masse).

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1
this review if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to
correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I0f1cf16c6bb0a62f29d7403a0914cdfa4aa16012

The configure_delegated_roles configure if the heat_stack_onwer role
would be created or not by keystone. Right now this is set to false,
without any way to override to true. This patch change this option to be
a parameter and it also change scenario001 to true in order to run heat
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I916cc4842ccef587a25b06cb422436953974e790
'}]
commit_message:
Set configure_delegated_roles a parameter

The configure_delegated_roles configure if the heat_stack_onwer role
would be created or not by keystone. Right now this is set to false,
without any way to override to true. This patch change this option to be
a parameter and it also change scenario001 to true in order to run heat
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I916cc4842ccef587a25b06cb422436953974e790

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 17:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I1d0fe929633acf632fcb4b266ec0c185b3107fb6
'}]
commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I1d0fe929633acf632fcb4b266ec0c185b3107fb6

subject: Reduce bind mount tasks
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 17:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce bind mount tasks

Additional bind mounts for the glance container can be
necessary and the number of tasks to configure them
it now reduced to one task, while the logic when
the additional bind mounts are necessary is now
defined within the `glance_container_bind_mounts`

Change-Id: Iceab2d32a72b415466fbc39e0fc2abe5f928232f
Closes-Bug: #1774037
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce bind mount tasks

Additional bind mounts for the glance container can be
necessary and the number of tasks to configure them
it now reduced to one task, while the logic when
the additional bind mounts are necessary is now
defined within the `glance_container_bind_mounts`

Change-Id: Iceab2d32a72b415466fbc39e0fc2abe5f928232f
Closes-Bug: #1774037

I'm fine with it but I spotted a couple of changes I'd like to propose in the reno."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-05-19 13:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-05-19 13:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-05 05:41:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I'm not 100% this is needed and I worry about adding a VIP for memcached to the 
loadbalancer, which caches authenticated objects and would provide an attack 
vector for an unauthenticated user to gain access to a cloud through a known 
public endpoint. While there's an ACL, which should protect memcached, from the 
perspective of the LB, the ability to have direct unauthenticated access via the 
LB to authenticated tokens is troubling for me even considering the effective 
ACL. 

If there's a good reason beyond the noted bug and community consensus to add 
this I'd be happy to change my -1 to the positive but for now I stand against 
this change as-is."}, {'account_id': 14552, 'date': '2017-12-05 15:36:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

As said in it's default configuration, keystone is not capable of using memcache for caching due to dogpile/python memcache issues when using a list of memcache backends. The only way currently out of this is either a VIP or locally deploy memcache inside the keystone container. Personally I tried to avoid the latter and not create service redundancy"}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-06 01:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-06 04:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I stand by my objection in PS4 and the big. The source of the bug is a configuration issue. Also note the documentation clarification bug has been resolved now and will shed light on the appropriate settings to use.'}, {'account_id': 14552, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Thanks Jimmy for replying. What os_keystone configured should have worked, the url:host,host:port scheme seemed to be the right configuration but it never worked with dogpile. I will retest it with a current pike version to see it this is still correct'}, {'account_id': 14552, 'date': '2019-05-16 18:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add memcached vip for keystone and other services

A VIP for memcached is provided  and now used as
primary URL for the cache service inside keystone.
The list of URLs inside dogpile/python-memcache
is not working correctly as discussed per
https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/dogpile.cache/issues/98/multiple-servers-in-backend-url-causes

Depends-On: I0a5761c14e0bf27ac36d4f27522fbb756bb70950

Change-Id: Id52cde285570284858636de578baa6e3f06cca54
Closes-Bug: #1681695
