revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-15 22:55:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova-config tag use for kvm hypervisor

The nova-config tag is primarily offered to reconfigure the
nova configuration, instead of installing components.
A erroneous nova-config tag attached to kvm install tasks, was
causing dependency issues due to missing, pip related facts,
when using nova-config tag alone.
The kvm installation is triggered via various tags like
nova-install instead.

Change-Id: I4a18618e514546b4aacb9dfb6f60008ae42695a9
Closes-Bug: #1667337
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-config tag use for kvm hypervisor

The nova-config tag is primarily offered to reconfigure the
nova configuration, instead of installing components.
A erroneous nova-config tag attached to kvm install tasks, was
causing dependency issues due to missing, pip related facts,
when using nova-config tag alone.
The kvm installation is triggered via various tags like
nova-install instead.

Change-Id: I4a18618e514546b4aacb9dfb6f60008ae42695a9
Closes-Bug: #1667337

commit_message:
Rename haproxy conf.d directory to templates

The directory /etc/haproxy/conf.d was renamed to templates
to better reflect the current situation that haproxy
still does not support inclusion of config files.

The old directory is renamed to incorporate local changes.

Change-Id: I9d5e2927a8e373aa66f2a7892ae70c1703ddf396
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all

commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I9c1b192cc8957cc83186d704b7c48eb186d144aa

[{'created': '2019-05-13 09:14:05.000000000', 'message': 'Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58
(cherry picked from commit 1a87298ac774d921709ab9cbe5016414db65783e)
'}]
commit_message:
Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58
(cherry picked from commit 1a87298ac774d921709ab9cbe5016414db65783e)

commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: Ieee74d4c8195579490936016fe0b4abe3d9b14ae

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-16 18:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, actually, the existing check was working correctly.

 2019-05-16 03:28:21.590 | +++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1846 :   echo '{"traits": ["COMPUTE_NET_ATTACH_INTERFACE", "COMPUTE_IMAGE_TYPE_QCOW2", "COMPUTE_IMAGE_TYPE_RAW", "CUSTOM_GOLD"], "resource_provider_generation": 2}'
 2019-05-16 03:28:21.590 | +++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1846 :   jq '.traits | contains(["CUSTOM_GOLD"])'
 2019-05-16 03:28:21.596 | ++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1846 :   [[ true == false ]]

The problem is further up, where `amount` is initialized to (total - reserved). We expect that to be >=1 but it ain't:

 2019-05-16 03:28:21.460 | +++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1838 :   curl -sH 'X-Auth-Token: gAAAAABc3NboGx8wIOwOGvM7-oBUANU-kqSQ69EdMMUuvFh3vsb03SVkSRkGoLBPdZEidFsOvS_EMGVWHm3DPW_esX7GogM7AsbrlINhdcfQt6FMb-px9nnM5YOirU92Rnx3agJCruUnS565zmgUPONruPMpQYvyTt4hfFVYQdo4aY6zbACdY_A' https://38.108.68.208/placement/resource_providers/4c19dc8a-ef90-4d24-83cf-e742109e16f1/inventories
 2019-05-16 03:28:21.464 | +++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1839 :   jq '.inventories.CUSTOM_BAREMETAL as $cls
 2019-05-16 03:28:21.464 |                     | ($cls.total // 0) - ($cls.reserved // 0)'
 2019-05-16 03:28:21.534 | ++ /opt/stack/ironic/devstack/lib/ironic:wait_for_nova_resources:1838 :   amount=0'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-16 18:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

OK so this isn't the problem, it's that the node isn't ready so the inventory is always set to reserved=1:

"Node 7c5e9503-1e20-42bf-9ae7-d14cef0f38a9 is not ready for a deployment, reporting resources as reserved for it. Node's provision state is cleaning, power state is power off and maintenance is False."

http://logs.openstack.org/11/659611/1/check/ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa/9c644a2/controller/logs/screen-ir-cond.txt.gz#_May_16_17_28_09_311564'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-16 16:10:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix trait check in devstack

The devstack code is checking that a trait exists
on the ironic node resource provider but is not
handling the case that it is one of many traits,
which is the case since Stein when nova started
reporting compute driver capability traits on each
compute node provider managed by that driver [1].

This fixes it by changing to use a simple grep for
the trait in the list of traits rather than the
confusing jq method.

[1] I15364d37fb7426f4eec00ca4eaf99bec50e964b6

Change-Id: I218576999ef22bce946fde697229c56516b51b38
Story: 2005725
Task: 31054
'}]
commit_message:
Fix trait check in devstack

The devstack code is checking that a trait exists
on the ironic node resource provider but is not
handling the case that it is one of many traits,
which is the case since Stein when nova started
reporting compute driver capability traits on each
compute node provider managed by that driver [1].

This fixes it by changing to use a simple grep for
the trait in the list of traits rather than the
confusing jq method.

[1] I15364d37fb7426f4eec00ca4eaf99bec50e964b6

Change-Id: I218576999ef22bce946fde697229c56516b51b38
Story: 2005725
Task: 31054

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ib2d10c734e99066c8d5364e25df6cdd8641f6760
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ib92186e88a3a54e0b6b00a4480fe6b461ad2f372
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name

commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I9b8bbec7d5aee3a385a947f0a88b53ba725da089

commit_message:
Update node to version 10 for release-zuul-python

Follow https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml#L221
and use nodejs 10.

This should fix the job, it currently has a too low yarn version
for the rest of the repo.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-16 09:27:53.000000000', 'message': 'Convert README.md to ReStructuredText format

Cherry-picked-from: Ib03230de5a20fa0c036a2aa9031dad9815ec6e98

--
Fix README.rst and add syntax check

Cherry-picked-from: I3559cccac407f0f6c72597bf874e3bfd4bfe7f76

--
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Cherry-picked-from: Icdf31c157dba7018770502517ad6cee87b73c16f
Change-Id: I8e009bfbb3fe01cf92e6cb6de58a1a8175ce9b70
'}]
commit_message:
Convert README.md to ReStructuredText format

Cherry-picked-from: Ib03230de5a20fa0c036a2aa9031dad9815ec6e98

--
Fix README.rst and add syntax check

Cherry-picked-from: I3559cccac407f0f6c72597bf874e3bfd4bfe7f76

--
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Cherry-picked-from: Icdf31c157dba7018770502517ad6cee87b73c16f
Change-Id: I8e009bfbb3fe01cf92e6cb6de58a1a8175ce9b70

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I25cca96431cdc97fce167c1c0be08c1169421fe8
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-11 03:04:13.000000000', 'message': 'HTK: Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting.

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk to instead retrieves the values, including the default,
from the configured settings.

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}, {'created': '2019-05-13 19:07:57.000000000', 'message': 'Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps lays
the groundwork needed to implement this change in htk, since
there is no sensible way to make the changes backward compatible.

A seperate ps will be created to update the htk function.

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}, {'created': '2019-05-14 21:50:05.000000000', 'message': 'Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk function to retrieve the weight value from the configured
setting if it exists, or default to use the original hardcoded
value of 10 if it is not set (for backward compatibility).

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}, {'created': '2019-05-14 21:51:59.000000000', 'message': 'Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk function to retrieve the weight value from the configured
setting if it exists, or default to use the original hardcoded
value of 10 if it is not set (for backward compatibility).

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}, {'created': '2019-05-14 22:03:29.000000000', 'message': 'Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk function to retrieve the weight value from the configured
setting if it exists, or default to use the original hardcoded
value of 10 if it is not set (for backward compatibility).

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}, {'created': '2019-05-14 22:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

This ps exposes the anti-affinity weight value, including
default, that will be consumed by the updated htk function.

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54
'}]
commit_message:
Expose Anti-Affinity Weight Setting

This ps exposes the anti-affinity weight value, including
default, that will be consumed by the updated htk function.

Change-Id: Id8eb303674764ef8b0664f62040723aaf77e0a54

commit_message:
Kibana: set read-only-fs

This PS permits read-only filesystems to back the containers by setting
the default to true

Additionally /run is uniformly applied across all long running pods
as a memory backed emptydir

Change-Id: Ia7344e2c8caa1f25101bf30445cdfe277f89c143

commit_message:
Cleanup nodepool DIB environment using anchors

Use a yaml anchor to clean up the nodepool config so the base DIB
environment settings used on all images do not need to be duplicated
many times.

Change-Id: I9c79b2e6e6877e51fde5489c8c9ff209b492d67c

commit_message:
[tripleo] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Ia12fbe9479a7f2556f0d1e58868643acf84748b7

[{'created': '2019-05-10 18:22:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all

Change-Id: I3240eb0eb6619dc4db275abddffb4c083f0619d1
'}]
commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I3240eb0eb6619dc4db275abddffb4c083f0619d1

commit_message:
Use the dynamic aio scenario

Rather than have to define a job per non-aio service, we have
zuul introspect the origin test repo and add the service name
to the scenario variable on the fly. This allows us to simplify
our job definitions and simply use the AIO job template for all
repositories.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658398
Change-Id: I8a957f38377e36b18fecb950504f2a0cd400b00c

In master down to Ocata, our images don't install pycrypto,

commit_message:
Add pycrypto into Ocata images explicitly

In master down to Ocata, our images don't install pycrypto,
unless it is in the project requirements, like heat [1].

This is a problem, as some projects, like nova, uses
keystonemiddleware, which relies on pycrypto in Ocata and
below [2].

This fixes the issue by ensuring Ocata and Newton have
pycrypto in the images.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/a1ba867f07870450d40c93f31b79c8c9984c469a/requirements.txt#L32
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/0b2a1ee40c78b449b9b2499c8e591e5aad8d3136/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_memcache_crypt.py

Change-Id: I33f3c1c7deb6716577b047ef2c2f08306ca6d5d3

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 and cap Sphinx on Python2

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix the requirements job which was broken by
https://review.opendev.org/657890 adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ieabcd4e8c5e5354125a63e89b9b60931c760858a
(cherry picked from commit 011fa22c42506e63229cca7e5fc65f81b6e0aabf)

commit_message:
Set concurrency control spec to release independent

The specification "Mechanism to Prevent Race Conditions Spec"
is release independent. It lays out a framework for
designing manila APIs and resource state machines to prevent
race conditions. Some of the work items have not been
completed, and will be addressed in Train and future
releases.

Change-Id: I4f9e754676507af417ccae920487d35d86b1ae29

subject: Share and back end capabilities improvements
messages: [{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-05-08 21:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-05-13 13:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2019-05-16 15:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 21:46:00.000000000', 'message': "Share and back end capabilities improvements

Move Stein spec to Train.

- Create new common capabilities for storage_protocol
  and shrinking_support and modify drivers to report
  these capabilities.
- Allow the shrink API to fail fast
  if the share is created on a back end that doesn't support
  it.
- Allow the pool-list to reliably report storage_protocol
  for all back ends/storage pools.

APIImpact
Partially-implements: bp storage-proto-enhancement
Partially-implements: bp make-share-shrinking-support-a-capability

Change-Id: I5ae65456d13bb421765ea6a77fcab21320af25c1
"}]
commit_message:
Share and back end capabilities improvements

Move Stein spec to Train.

- Create new common capabilities for storage_protocol
  and shrinking_support and modify drivers to report
  these capabilities.
- Allow the shrink API to fail fast
  if the share is created on a back end that doesn't support
  it.
- Allow the pool-list to reliably report storage_protocol
  for all back ends/storage pools.

APIImpact
Partially-implements: bp storage-proto-enhancement
Partially-implements: bp make-share-shrinking-support-a-capability

Change-Id: I5ae65456d13bb421765ea6a77fcab21320af25c1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I32f90005a31b1ce844feffc0fed0f46ff57976be

commit_message:
Remove paste

Removes all the deprecated resources for paste
support in keystone which we notified about in Stein.

Keystone doesn't use paste so it doesn't work in Stein
either so we remove it for Train.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658546/
Change-Id: Id7dfdf2f5cb9453044d39812b7cbd216b7f3eb50

commit_message:
Move unimplemented specifications to separate folder

This cleans up stuff so users and documentation
folks can be sure that targeted specifications
have been implemented in one form or another.

Change-Id: I0a8daab3ba55ff43b3db8433077eb667b84a5ee2

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I188923dc2896866c9fa955678d9564501fc0caae

subject: Verify image checksums after upload
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-06 17:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-06 17:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2019-05-06 17:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-06 18:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16068, 'date': '2019-05-06 18:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-05-07 10:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for pointing this Clark. Unfortunately there are few issues here:

- md5, sha256 are suppressed currently and not end up here (BaseImageProxy.create_image do not pass them further)
- checksum MIGHT be null, which will lead to exception here
- there are some clouds, which will reprocess image in the backend and modify the checksum.
- there is huge refactor patch for the image service (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651534/) where I try to address this as well'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-07 19:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for pointing this Clark. Unfortunately there are few issues
 > here:
 > 
 > - md5, sha256 are suppressed currently and not end up here
 > (BaseImageProxy.create_image do not pass them further)
 > - checksum MIGHT be null, which will lead to exception here

I think we should error if checksum is null because we can't do proper verification in that case. (And work with glance if we need to ensure they do the hashing inline so it is done when upload is complete).

 > - there are some clouds, which will reprocess image in the backend
 > and modify the checksum.

That completely breaks the user's ability to confirm they have a good image in glance. If this is an issue we need to work with glance to either do verification itself or perhaps carry multiple checksums for the before and after.

 > - there is huge refactor patch for the image service
 > (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651534/) where I try to address
 > this as well

Good to know this is something others are wanting to fix as this is definitely an issue we've run into in production. Thank you for doing that.

Should I abandon this change given the one linked above?"}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-05-08 06:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > - md5, sha256 are suppressed currently and not end up here
 > > (BaseImageProxy.create_image do not pass them further)
 > > - checksum MIGHT be null, which will lead to exception here
 > 
 > I think we should error if checksum is null because we can't do
 > proper verification in that case. (And work with glance if we need
 > to ensure they do the hashing inline so it is done when upload is
 > complete).

I have introduced verify_checksum parameter to create_image, which will allow this. Default is true, so nodepool gets what it needs, but there is still possibility to bypass this for "bad clouds"

  > > - there are some clouds, which will reprocess image in the
 > backend
 > > and modify the checksum.
 > 
 > That completely breaks the user's ability to confirm they have a
 > good image in glance. If this is an issue we need to work with
 > glance to either do verification itself or perhaps carry multiple
 > checksums for the before and after.

Agree, but that is how it is and at least in one case used really in production. I assume actually all "Huawei-based" clouds have that issue.
 > 
 > > - there is huge refactor patch for the image service
 > > (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651534/) where I try to address
 > > this as well
 > 
 > Good to know this is something others are wanting to fix as this is
 > definitely an issue we've run into in production. Thank you for
 > doing that.
 > 
 > Should I abandon this change given the one linked above?

Let's do it this way and I would appreciate your review there for this particular issue'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-16 15:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been taken up in the refactor of image uploading instead.'}]

commit_message:
Verify image checksums after upload

The OpenStack Infra team noticed that nodepool (via openstack sdk)
uploaded an invalid image. This prevented node boots from completing
successfully and would have been caught by a simple checksum check step.

Add this step to prevent openstacksdk users from attempting to use bad
image uploads.

Change-Id: If9eafdd7b60098ed5bbc37ad06757a6f7e348b4d

commit_message:
Support sriovdp arbitrary resource names

This patch adds ability to work with new sriov device plugin's
feature. This feature implies arbitrary names for resource.
So kuryr-kubernetes should also know about such resources.
Resources are listed in /etc/pcidp/config.json

If physnet_resource_mappings is not specified it's assumed
resource name is physnet.

Implements: blueprint move-to-new-sriovdp
Change-Id: I07c5338b6d5b431435c467b0c52b50fe3385a86a
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

readme is used as the package long description on pypi, and

commit_message:
Fix rst errors in README

This fixes some rst formatting errors in the README file. The
readme is used as the package long description on pypi, and
they have recently enabled some checks that cause package
upload errors if there are formatting issues with the rst
content.

Change-Id: I3ff7a509c2b875606c985c87b61a63c5e15c1bda
(cherry picked from commit be83eae483cd864d882fc2ef209c8b1d1724a42b)

subject: Validate output of list_logical_volumes
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-05-15 17:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-05-16 14:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 17:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Validate output of list_logical_volumes

The charm was checking for the zeroth value of the return value of
list_logical_volumes. However, if no logical volumes are found it
returns an empty list.

This change validates that the list has an entry.

Change-Id: I75a6b1dda15dd7c2cece8cfe97b28317b3d5162b
Partial-Bug: #1819382
'}]
commit_message:
Validate output of list_logical_volumes

The charm was checking for the zeroth value of the return value of
list_logical_volumes. However, if no logical volumes are found it
returns an empty list.

This change validates that the list has an entry.

Change-Id: I75a6b1dda15dd7c2cece8cfe97b28317b3d5162b
Partial-Bug: #1819382

messages: [{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-05-15 16:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-15 19:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-05-16 13:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\nMerging to unblock the repo.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 15:21:20.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Id9a875393e42d9fc54d8c571d368180fec122839
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Id9a875393e42d9fc54d8c571d368180fec122839
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Blacklist Bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option, a fix
is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: I110829ef960e3ee146f47871ef076491244bf4fa
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add the missing protocol for listener

According to the octavia api:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/#listeners,
there miss the 'HTTPS' protocol.

Change-Id: I1d4857876a151148348ac79d554db2c4c6616559

commit_message:
Revert "Adding support for DPDK to openvswitch image"

This reverts commit a3d324b5b6a1ea9945a947776410953e3b423fdf.

This causes issues [1] when trying to use the built image inside
the OSH repos, which is a first step of a pipeline from image
building to full testing.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/66/658766/1/check/openstack-helm-infra-openstack-support/c35a41e/

Change-Id: Ie7432a205f957ed13cf3f502daf05d6b8cdb32b8

[{'created': '2019-05-15 10:26:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix validations_inputs temporary file name

All the validations were failing when running through Mistral with a
`sudo` command not allowed issue [1] due to a typo in the file name.

This patch fixes the name of the temporary files containing potential
ansible variables.

[1] mistral : command not allowed ; TTY=unknown ; PWD=/ ; USER=root
 ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/chown -h validations: /tmp/validation_inputs_PoJRZa

Change-Id: I6699bbbab5cb15a8fd200c144a3d575e9f29ca37
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validations_inputs temporary file name

All the validations were failing when running through Mistral with a
`sudo` command not allowed issue [1] due to a typo in the file name.

This patch fixes the name of the temporary files containing potential
ansible variables.

[1] mistral : command not allowed ; TTY=unknown ; PWD=/ ; USER=root
 ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/chown -h validations: /tmp/validation_inputs_PoJRZa

Change-Id: I6699bbbab5cb15a8fd200c144a3d575e9f29ca37
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Use the 'real' name for the LXC image
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-05-13 09:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-05-15 21:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nthis is missing a "cherry picked from <commit-id>" line in the commit message'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-05-16 00:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20147, 'date': '2019-05-16 09:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-05-16 13:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 09:34:38.000000000', 'message': "Use the 'real' name for the LXC image

The Open Build Service repository for the Leap 15.0 LXC image returns
a metalink which causes aria2c to download 2 files. The first is an
empty file (the metalink) and the second is the actual LXC image. The
name of the second file changes frequently.

This change uses the `--on-download-complete` callback of aria2c to
call a helper script which links the expected filename to the actual
filename.

Change-Id: I9a2bc7ded20f772af82956a81a9864c7ee17039c
"}]
commit_message:
Use the 'real' name for the LXC image

The Open Build Service repository for the Leap 15.0 LXC image returns
a metalink which causes aria2c to download 2 files. The first is an
empty file (the metalink) and the second is the actual LXC image. The
name of the second file changes frequently.

This change uses the `--on-download-complete` callback of aria2c to
call a helper script which links the expected filename to the actual
filename.

Change-Id: I9a2bc7ded20f772af82956a81a9864c7ee17039c

commit_message:
Remove prevent-arp-spoofing warning messages.

This patch removes prevent-arp-spoofing warning log messages when it is
set to true, and the OpenStack release is >= ocata. It does not remove
the configuration option itself.

Change-Id: Ida1d67331e6d2df3d88d782125b8914f7dea5704
Closes-Bug: 1754386

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 11:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Initial prototype for simple RPC health checks

Some frameworks (like kubernetes) would benefit from having a chance
to find out at least basic state of a service by sending an RPC call.

This is an idea of just a primitive methods residing in server side of
the RPC API. Such simple method might be already good enough for basic
health check, as clients (created by health probes) can call it and
make sure the service is alive.

This could continue with adding some more elaborate checks in future.

Example: see https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/49b58b7e7d51ac9fc793512a2a26403ac6af65e3
for a change where nova health probe was introduced in openstack-helm.

Change-Id: Icfaccb11d871bc3c1be0d3e2e1cfee49fafe3655
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Initial prototype for simple RPC health checks

Some frameworks (like kubernetes) would benefit from having a chance
to find out at least basic state of a service by sending an RPC call.

This is an idea of just a primitive methods residing in server side of
the RPC API. Such simple method might be already good enough for basic
health check, as clients (created by health probes) can call it and
make sure the service is alive.

This could continue with adding some more elaborate checks in future.

Example: see https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/49b58b7e7d51ac9fc793512a2a26403ac6af65e3
for a change where nova health probe was introduced in openstack-helm.

Change-Id: Icfaccb11d871bc3c1be0d3e2e1cfee49fafe3655

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 00:30:17.000000000', 'message': 'Enable kolla-ansible to customize policy configurations in Ceilometer

We wanted/needed to customize the resource archiving policies in
 ceilometer, and to do that, we needed to use a custom file (instead
 of overwriting the default one). That is why we enabled this process
 on Kolla-ansible

 Kolla-ansible did not provide support to customize that file
 "gnocchi_resources.yaml". Therefore, this PR adds this "feature"
 to it (kolla-ansible) by adding a method to manage
 "custom_gnocchi_resources.yaml" file.

Change-Id: If939345f4d6bf2bf1b32ee532e3435b026043975
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable kolla-ansible to customize policy configurations in Ceilometer

We wanted/needed to customize the resource archiving policies in
 ceilometer, and to do that, we needed to use a custom file (instead
 of overwriting the default one). That is why we enabled this process
 on Kolla-ansible

 Kolla-ansible did not provide support to customize that file
 "gnocchi_resources.yaml". Therefore, this PR adds this "feature"
 to it (kolla-ansible) by adding a method to manage
 "custom_gnocchi_resources.yaml" file.

Change-Id: If939345f4d6bf2bf1b32ee532e3435b026043975
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

commit_message:
Fix subnet host_routes error

When updating subnet with "no-host-route" option, set host_routes to an empty list as neutron_lib.api.validators expected.

Change-Id: I6fe039793d813758429c7a104fd40172b4f8122b
Closes-Bug: #1747101

- gate-manila-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/62/392262/2/check/gate-manila-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/521c214//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 33s
- gate-manila-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/62/392262/2/check/gate-manila-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/28062b6/ : SUCCESS in 1m 32s'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2016-11-17 09:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(18 comments)

This spec addresses important issues but IMO it is not sufficiently
baked that we should just approve it an proceed to implementation.
I'd like to see explicit discussion of why manila is going to build
its own jobs tracking system when OpenStack provides potential
alternatives (explain why we're not guilty of NIH).  We need explicit
justification of the job details table.  And I'd like us to think more
about all the actions that it makes sense for admins to perform on
jobs and whether the DB layout described here is sufficient.  Offhand,
for example, I would think we'd want to support Job Suspend, Job Graceful Shutdown, and Job Terminate Without Prejudice ..."}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2016-11-17 10:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2016-11-17 14:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Some remarks inline.

I don't think the question about concurrent *requests* against a
limit (on the number of concurrent jobs) has been answered.

Nor do I think we have sufficient discussion here to discount the
need to be able to suspend, gracefully terminate, or immediately
terminate jobs.  You mentioned that we decided at the BCN summit
that we don't want "data-job-abort" rather than "migration-abort."
That's fine, but it's not an argument against adding suspend actions
(for migration or backup or some other job) and tracking that in
the jobs table.  After all, you don't start a migration by acting
at the jobs level directly either.

Thank you for making the reasoning for building our own job tracking
infrastructure rather than using mistral or building on taskflow.  The
"don't want to have external dependencies" argument is however hard
to evaluate unless we've examined these to see whether they would otherwise be good or poor fits for our needs.  Certainly the desire
to avoid external dependencies isn't an absolute principle or we'd
never use anything from oslo.

I support figuring out a way to continue this design and work in
ocata, I just don't favor approving it without more investigation
just because we are approaching our first deadline.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-11-17 18:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-17 18:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add spec for Data Jobs table

As Share Migration feature is introduced and other "job-like" features are in
the roadmap, such as Share Backup, it creates the need to track and maintain
them as jobs, as they can take unbounded amounts of time to complete.

This spec discusses the proposal of the Data Jobs table feature for
the Ocata release of OpenStack Manila.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I0853d61393bdaab793d529b7cc34e7f4cddd7a27
Partially-implements: blueprint data-service-jobs-table

(14 comments)

I've made some writing suggestions inline - most are nits that I won't push back on if you disagree because for the most part your meaning is clear enough.

But before this merges I do think it is worth dealing with the CLI questions Mark raised and spelling out the url and body in the rest API as Xing requested.

Additionally, I'd like a conversation about permissions.  Suppose that Rodrigo and Tom are in the same keystone project and have permission to create and mount shares, as well as to use these new data service APIs.  The shares are for the sake of argument NFS shares and have POSIX file system permissions.  Although Tom has permission to mount the share where both /home/tbarron and /home/rodrigo reside, he does *not* have permission to do 'rm -rf /home/rodrigo'.

What is to prevent Tom from circumventing the POSIX permissions and doing 'manila data-erase some-share /home/rodrigo' ?"}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-23 19:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-23 19:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Your proposal might be best, but I think we should see how it'll look with empty(?) paths."}, {'account_id': 11047, 'date': '2016-05-24 16:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2016-05-24 16:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Rodrigo, thanks for responding to my questions and nits inline.

At this point my only remaining "big issue" (and I hope it just turns out to be a non-issue) is that the data deletion service appears to allow deletion of subtrees in the file system, so that tbarron can delete /home/ganso and ganso can delete /home/tbarroon if they both have data copy privileges on the relevant shares.  There is no mapping of file system (say POSIX) permissions to cloud tenant permissions, so I worry about the substitution of external cloud data services for in-host manipulation of the data, where in the latter case the file system itself has a permissions and authorization system that isn't reflected in the cloud itself.

Once this issue is talked through and documented I think I'm good to go with this spec.  Nice work!'}, {'account_id': 11047, 'date': '2016-05-24 16:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Regarding "erase" permission. We still need to talk this through because it is scary, but "erase" is basically just "delete share"+"create share" except you can keep the export location (and maybe? keep it mounted).  So the person that creates/deletes shares can wipe one clean, but some joeuser who has a home dir on there wouldn't be going into horizon to wipe them all clean.  The fact that sub-dirs are in the API allows some other cleanup use cases, but still it would be a share owner doing it.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-24 16:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for raising this concern Tom. It is indeed a problem, but currently no different than mouting NFS without root squash, see http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/hnbio5l5wq6oykjj

As stated in several sections, the user is responsible for the data operations within the shares he has access to.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-24 16:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

correcting my previous comment: the tenant is responsible. The term "user" may refer to a guest accessing the share, through a RW or RO access permission, but without access to horizon or Manila API'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2016-05-24 21:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I need to think through the consequences here when a single human being ("user") is both a posix file system user and a tenant in the OpenStack cloud.

Thanks for your patience.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2016-05-25 02:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from data-service-api to bp/driver-data-service-helper'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-25 11:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/driver-data-service-helper to data-service-api'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-25 11:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Goutham, this is unrelated to bp/driver-data-service-helper'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2016-05-26 10:23:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks for your patience while I thought this issue through :)

I realize that I was framing this whole permissions concern wrong.  I was thinking of an ordinary POSIX file system user somehow bypassing those permissions by using the data service api.  But the situation is really that a share owner will be able to operate on the data in that share without having to mount it, su to root, and run commands.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2016-05-26 16:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-26 17:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add spec for Data Service API

With the introduction of the Data Service in Mitaka, rises the
possibility of allowing an user to request the Data Service to
copy data between shares (or snapshots, if they are mountable),
which may be more efficient than manually doing it.

Change-Id: Ia52bd858f4be1662419a31c6c629199b3c5ccd66

commit_message:
Add spec for Share Retype

Share Retype feature was briefly discussed in Mitaka Midcycle
and briefly discussed again in Newton Summit. We agreed to propose
a spec to discuss the design.

This is a feature that is dependent on Share Migration, where a
user may retype a share, which can be performed by the driver
in the same backend, or require the share to be migrated.

Change-Id: I1598854680a172a0f50c4591b316babdaeda88f7

commit_message:
Add multipath to nova-compute AppArmor profile

Deploying nova-compute with apparmor in enforce mode causes it to fail
to attach volumes with multipath. This patch fixes it by updating the
nova-compute apparmor profile to include paths and binaries needed for
multipath.

Change-Id: Icc2d187fa3dd63e0930d57a87e7a60ff386f0032
Closes-bug: #1826467

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 14:10:44.000000000', 'message': 'Drop systemd support from PAM

The line being removed is the cause of audit.log spam with a
SELinux enforcing (and permissive) system. They are due to the
fact we're calling "sudo" from within some containers, and PAM
wants to connect to the host "dbus" socket (mounted in /run).
This action is obviously denied by SELinux.

The "-" prefix makes this module optional anyway, but apparently
PAM does see it and tries to use it.

Dropping this module has no consequences other than preventing
log spamming.

Change-Id: I3e0e86026f5a4a78473bed824cd1682d3a020cd5
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <mbaldess@redhat.com>
Resolves-Bug: #1819461
(cherry picked from commit c4b62490714ea849cedfe07d4b9a6aebf1f815c0)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop systemd support from PAM

The line being removed is the cause of audit.log spam with a
SELinux enforcing (and permissive) system. They are due to the
fact we're calling "sudo" from within some containers, and PAM
wants to connect to the host "dbus" socket (mounted in /run).
This action is obviously denied by SELinux.

The "-" prefix makes this module optional anyway, but apparently
PAM does see it and tries to use it.

Dropping this module has no consequences other than preventing
log spamming.

Change-Id: I3e0e86026f5a4a78473bed824cd1682d3a020cd5
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <mbaldess@redhat.com>
Resolves-Bug: #1819461
(cherry picked from commit c4b62490714ea849cedfe07d4b9a6aebf1f815c0)

commit_message:
Prepare OSA release for Stein

This bumps the projects shas to their HEAD of their
stable/stein branch. Some projects have branched
since the last bump, so this patch also make sure
the correct branch is tracked.

It also ensures the roles are properly frozen, and
can follow the usual 2 week's bumping process.

Change-Id: I038354c5e55ed9440c2116e4291cf09b78734c6d

commit_message:
Remove octavia tempest plugin from setup.cfg

The octavia.tests.tempest.plugin:OctaviaTempestPlugin was removed in
commit I3082962841d3b645f3cbd1a6b41fc7fb28dcf7e6 and should also be
removed from setup.cfg

commit_message:
Re-add undercloud-aodh.yaml

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/611188/ incorrectly removed the
undercloud-aodh.yaml environment file as we still reference it in
python-tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I458dd389ef8a953d5ec8f2bcb0fa454fe0ffffcb
Closes-Bug: #1828893
(cherry picked from commit aeb91c34f88d13f2ee604714ab9facf5a8669925)

[{'created': '2019-05-14 16:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix NovaNfs role parameter precedence in conditions

I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e changed the Nova NFS params to be
role specific, however the global param still takes precedence in the
enable_live_migration_tunnelled condition.
With this change the the global param is only considered when the role
specific param is not set.

Change-Id: I3d1a0f632e8a7e4924ebabdc795c0ef5d53cdd6d
Related-Bug: 1823712
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameter precedence in conditions

I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e changed the Nova NFS params to be
role specific, however the global param still takes precedence in the
enable_live_migration_tunnelled condition.
With this change the the global param is only considered when the role
specific param is not set.

Change-Id: I3d1a0f632e8a7e4924ebabdc795c0ef5d53cdd6d
Related-Bug: 1823712

commit_message:
[redhat] Update variables to be version agnostic

The RedHat-based operating systems such as CentOS have a pretty
stable list of packages, therefore, we don't need to pin it by
version and we can instead move to a much more generic redhat.yml
which will support a bigger range of systems.

This patch also sets up the mode for the /etc/mysql directory
to be 755 for things to work.  We should lock that down eventually
for only the MySQL user.

Change-Id: I2e9ee987a353a28da00cd37cbdb82ec46ccc414c

commit_message:
Add hostname as a new config option

Without this option, the charm announces its API URL with the VIP
address. It is problematic when using FQDN in the SAN section of the
certificates and not IP addresses.

Change-Id: Id40f7f3d70c1e9b055bd0ed65c1c9a90c95f84c1
Closes-Bug: 1826225

commit_message:
Ensure we aren't running some dry-run also for Pacemaker case

I5851dc7820fdcc4f5790980d94b81622ce3b0c8d corrected the dry-run case
only for non-HA setup.

The HA case was overlooked since it doesn't inherits from the non-HA.

Change-Id: Id678bbc2127bc3742d3c254ff4f62fc1b0e27daa
Related-Bug: #1823841

commit_message:
Fix loading of notification plugins

Inconsistent naming of plugins can cause an import error. This
commit standardises the naming so that all imports are parsed
correctly.

Story: 2005545
Task: 30689

Change-Id: Ife27fed83d28d47cc99ee07c4a8c0c4dac32c2da

commit_message:
Update fwaas configuration for user-defined L3 Agents

The stock L3 Agent of Neutron defines the attribute router_distributed
which is directly used by FWaaS. However, if the user uses any other L3
agent, then it is possible that the attribute router_distributed isn't
defined. Therefore FWaaS config now allows setting the
router_distributed attribute to avoid the issue.

This attribute is not requried when using the default L3 agent of neutron.

Closes-Bug: #1597132
Change-Id: I9cad2460fb4f8baf71122c101bfdaa88c3b4977b

subject: don't change ownership of empty OSD directories
messages:
[{'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-04-10 01:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-04-10 01:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-04-10 01:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2019-04-10 02:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:59:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This commit message seems to describe an alternate thing that doesn't match what the code does. It seems, to me, that the code is actually looking for the 'magic' file to identify mounted OSDs, rather than identifying and skipping empty directories"}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-05-16 11:02:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow+1

icey, for me at least the commit message is inline with what the code is doing. If the osd disk is not mounted you'll have:

/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-1 (empty)


and if it is you'll have:

/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-1/magic

i.e. the directory will exist in both but not contain the expected file if not mounted, which is what the code is doing and I think the commit message describes the same."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 01:13:03.000000000', 'message': 'don't change ownership of empty OSD directories

dirs_need_ownership_update detects when OSD directories require an
ownership change from root to ceph. However if an OSD directory exists,
but the OSD is not yet mounted, then the directory is expected to be
owned by root.

This may happen if an OSD is stopped or the OSD is no longer in use,
including on reboot when the OSD may not yet be started before the
config_changed hook runs.

The logic in check_for_upgrade uses this check to decide if a previous
upgrade failed, then incorrectly tries to resume an upgrade that never
existed. This will cause the charm to get stuck forever inside of the
config_changed hook on reboot with the following juju status:
"Waiting on <host> to finish upgrading"

This will fix the majority of such cases, however some corner cases may
still exist and further improvements need to be made to the
check_for_upgrade resume logic (LP #1823822)

Change-Id: If9d7e5bcfc0b1f152643a14432e76572ac14a812
Closes-Bug: #1779828
'}, {'created': '2019-04-10 01:15:00.000000000', 'message': "don't change ownership of empty OSD directories

dirs_need_ownership_update detects when OSD directories require an
ownership change from root to ceph. However if an OSD directory exists,
but the OSD is not yet mounted, then the directory is expected to be
owned by root.

This may happen if an OSD is stopped or the OSD is no longer in use,
including on reboot when the OSD may not yet be started before hooks
run.

Change-Id: If9d7e5bcfc0b1f152643a14432e76572ac14a812
Closes-Bug: #1779828
"}, {'created': '2019-04-10 01:15:48.000000000', 'message': "don't change ownership of empty OSD directories

dirs_need_ownership_update detects when OSD directories require an
ownership change from root to ceph. However if an OSD directory exists,
but the OSD is not yet mounted, then the directory is expected to be
owned by root.

This may happen if an OSD is stopped or the OSD is no longer in use,
including on reboot when the OSD may not yet be started before hooks
run.

Change-Id: If9d7e5bcfc0b1f152643a14432e76572ac14a812
Partial-Bug: #1779828
"}]
commit_message:
don't change ownership of empty OSD directories

dirs_need_ownership_update detects when OSD directories require an
ownership change from root to ceph. However if an OSD directory exists,
but the OSD is not yet mounted, then the directory is expected to be
owned by root.

This may happen if an OSD is stopped or the OSD is no longer in use,
including on reboot when the OSD may not yet be started before hooks
run.

Change-Id: If9d7e5bcfc0b1f152643a14432e76572ac14a812
Partial-Bug: #1779828

Can you create tap service and tap flow?
I could not create them in my local environment which applied your patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-14 03:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Hi Kaz, 
You can check if the CLI is there or not using the following steps

a) $ virtualenv testEnv
b) source it, $ source testcmd/bin/activate
c) Go to /opt/stack/python-openstackclient or whereever is your checked out openstackclient Dir.
d) 'install' osc locally in virtualenv from OSC root dir " $ pip install -e ."
e) Go to tap-as-a-service directory, and download this patch
f) run "$ pip install -e ."
If it fails in creating NEUTRON, then run "$ pip install -r requirements.txt" and then run "$ pip install -e ." again.
g) check which openstack is running and see where it points also
$ which openstack 
h) running "openstack help" will show tap CLIs.

Hope this helps'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-14 05:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-14 05:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Let me clarify your plan. AFAIK, TaaS team is trying to be part of Neutron Stadium. Do you plan to add OSC support in TaaS repository first and then move to neutronclient repo?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-03-15 14:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-16 00:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

@Akihiro : As per the discussion with Richard in an earlier release of NeutronClient to OSC migration, it was decided that except LB, FW, VPN ( and probably bgp) , other dependent projects would create OSC  Plugins in their own Repo.
We dont mind moving it in NeutronClient, but need to be sure if being a part of stadium required us to implement it in the NeutronClient ( I mean if its a necessary  condition ?)'}, {'account_id': 7018, 'date': '2017-03-22 20:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

per guide[1], if TaaS wants to be a part of neutron governance, then it makes sense to move it to neutronclient. I think the reason why Richard might have mentioned those projects is because at the time of discussion, those were the neutron stadium projects.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-neutronclient/devref/transition_to_osc.html'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-23 00:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

@Abhishek Raut : I guess the guide still needs to be reworked upon once...
And my question again would be, if it is necessary for a project to be a part of NeutronClient if they want to be a part of Neutron Stadium'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-23 14:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

Seems this needs to be moved to NeutronClient for inclusion in Neutron Stadium :('}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-03-23 14:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

commit_message:
Add support for TaaS for OSC

Following patch adds support for OSC migration
of Tap-as-a-service client.

Change-Id: If06b7cb9bad4a584d84c5a305f94253f9e6ed826
Closes-Bug: #1565622

Add new protocols in Firewalls

Firewall rules can now also filter DCCP and
SCTP protocols.

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Ifdad77dfc957ed90da88efe729cc6b35e96f0392
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Add support for Ceilometer custom gnocchi_resources.yaml

By default, Ceilometer uses gnocchi_resources.yaml as cfg_file that defines
the metric archive policy and metrics send to gnocchi. Users may want to define
their own strategy.

Change-Id: I49ba34588101ac2b4f450067c8c9a354134063bb
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>

commit_message:
Provide support for neutron dev mode in kolla

Add a possibility to mount sources as volumes to containers,
in "more than documentation" way. That will let us to use kolla
as a replacement for devstack.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I4868ed6829bd037e1012d1f40c4a1d1b9995bf95

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 06:55:00.000000000', 'message': "undercloud: resolve undercloud_*_host

The problem we're solving here is that our operators using SSL + FQDN
based endpoints will have failures during the deployment because we
don't lookup the FQDN into IP addresses, needed later in the deployment
for proper binding.

This patch transforms undercloud_*_host parameters into IP addresses:

- We raise if lookup returns nothing.
- We raise if lookup returns more than one IP.
- We support both IPv4 and IPv6.
- We raise if the IP is a loopback.
- We raise if the returned IP is invalid.

Utils changes:

* Introduce utils.is_valid_ip.
  Return True if the IP is either v4 or v6. Return False otherwise.

* Introduce utils.is_loopback.
  Return True if the given host is a loopback. Return False otherwise.

* Introduce utils.get_host_ips.
  Returns a list of IPs for a host to lookup.

* Introduce utils.get_single_ip.
  Translate an hostname or FQDN into an IP address if it is valid IP.
  Return it unchanged if it is an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
  If the host is not reachable, it'll raise an exception.
  By default it excludes the loopbacks but it can be allowed by setting
  allow_loopback = True.

* Use utils.get_single_ip to translate undercloud_admin_host and
  undercloud_public_host to IP addresses.

Related-Bug: #1763776
Change-Id: Ic008cc758493aa95e8aa237d23c2f66c0a930509
(cherry picked from commit c925c3b93bf02538c9308baf91aa0c7cc6dd20e9)
"}]
commit_message:
undercloud: resolve undercloud_*_host

The problem we're solving here is that our operators using SSL + FQDN
based endpoints will have failures during the deployment because we
don't lookup the FQDN into IP addresses, needed later in the deployment
for proper binding.

This patch transforms undercloud_*_host parameters into IP addresses:

- We raise if lookup returns nothing.
- We raise if lookup returns more than one IP.
- We support both IPv4 and IPv6.
- We raise if the IP is a loopback.
- We raise if the returned IP is invalid.

Utils changes:

* Introduce utils.is_valid_ip.
  Return True if the IP is either v4 or v6. Return False otherwise.

* Introduce utils.is_loopback.
  Return True if the given host is a loopback. Return False otherwise.

* Introduce utils.get_host_ips.
  Returns a list of IPs for a host to lookup.

* Introduce utils.get_single_ip.
  Translate an hostname or FQDN into an IP address if it is valid IP.
  Return it unchanged if it is an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
  If the host is not reachable, it'll raise an exception.
  By default it excludes the loopbacks but it can be allowed by setting
  allow_loopback = True.

* Use utils.get_single_ip to translate undercloud_admin_host and
  undercloud_public_host to IP addresses.

Related-Bug: #1763776
Change-Id: Ic008cc758493aa95e8aa237d23c2f66c0a930509
(cherry picked from commit c925c3b93bf02538c9308baf91aa0c7cc6dd20e9)

This deployment was for getting the hostname of pre-provisioned nodes.
This is no longer required with config-download since a HostnameMap is
required to be used with config-download.

Change-Id: I35d7d03c5373a251dfe96c2f71c4915ee52f113a
implements: reduce-deployment-resources
'}]
commit_message:
Remove HostEntryDeployment

This deployment was for getting the hostname of pre-provisioned nodes.
This is no longer required with config-download since a HostnameMap is
required to be used with config-download.

Change-Id: I35d7d03c5373a251dfe96c2f71c4915ee52f113a

commit_message:
Remove InstanceIdDeployment

This deployment is no longer needed as it was only setting metadata that
was used by os-collect-config. Now that config-download is used,
os-collect-config is no longer used, we can get rid of this deployment.

Change-Id: Icd45f7299c4053373b3161d90ad32135c9f40e5a
implements: reduce-deployment-resources

subject: Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 15:57:19.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I719a8cff50dcc0dea62db14edf7b9ab35b72facd
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I719a8cff50dcc0dea62db14edf7b9ab35b72facd
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

[{'created': '2019-05-16 05:55:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'haproxy' tags to all load balancing tasks

Sometimes we just want to modify the haproxy configuration.

Instead of applying all roles, we can run the playbook by adding
"-t haproxy" on the command line to modify the haproxy configuration
for all services.

Change-Id: I0ae07373285b61f976930d4769ea83eae2863850
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-05-16 10:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Move haproxy role tags to play

There is no need to distinguish between haproxy-config tasks and
haproxy.

* Move haproxy role tags to play.
* Remove the service tag from haproxy-config tasks

Change-Id: I0ae07373285b61f976930d4769ea83eae2863850
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move haproxy role tags to play

There is no need to distinguish between haproxy-config tasks and
haproxy.

* Move haproxy role tags to play.
* Remove the service tag from haproxy-config tasks

Change-Id: I0ae07373285b61f976930d4769ea83eae2863850
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add rcp_transport parameter for conductor

When Ironic Conductor requires optimizations over WAN, like some Edge
computing cases, allow configuring its [DEFAULT] rpc_transport setting.
F.e. rpc_transport may be set to 'json-rpc' for Ironic conductor
instances running at the edge sites, when the used messaging broker
should not be stretched over WAN. For such cases, this option also
plays nicely alongside the [conductor] conductor_group setting.

Related-Blueprint: undercloud-minion

Change-Id: Iad2f73f730315e8b3f0d5d809458626c9ebc890e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
